3240 36TH ST,
GRAND RAPIDS, MI, 49512-8193
Re: License #: CI410337023
Dear Jason M Lheureux:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 07/08/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Consultant spoke with Chief Administrator about the new electronic system for
record keeping called WeCare. This new electronic system was put into place
during this reporting period. Technical assistance was provided to ensure for
case service plans dates are within the same time frames required by the
rules. A technical error from the system that was found was the end date of the
report was the same start date of the next report instead of the next report
having the start date of the day after the end date of the pervious report. Chief
Administrator will be working with the IT to make sure this is corrected in the
system.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Annual Assessment received on 07/11/2025. Chief
Administrator notes with the report that since the last reporting period there has
continued to be slow movement with youth admits and discharges due to the
increased need for 1:1 staffing due to the more acutely impaired clients on the unit.

The facility continues to operate under the BCBA model and has BCBA
professionals on staff. Within the BCBA team they have continued to train staff
toward RBT standards, have implemented extensive behavioral plans, shaping
programs, crisis response and other tools to assist staff in better treating of the
youth. Chief Administrator notes staff have responded to this model and apply a
trauma informed, person led, but behaviorally oriented interventions in daily milieu
interactions. The facility continues to work towards restraint reduction and notes
due to the high acuity of youth on the milieu have led to increased restraint
numbers. Wedgwood administration team continues to meet frequently to discuss
concerns and to make collaborative decisions regarding practices that impact the
license.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. Staff reported they feel supported by their direct supervisors and feel
they have a good supportive team they work with. Staff reported they feel well
trained to work with their youth at the facility and noted they have specialized
BCBA support to make sure the unique needs of the youth are being met. Staff
reported they are well versed in the safety and behavior plans for all the youth at
the facility as this is constantly being discussed amongst the team.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The youth reported they feel safe at the facility. They reported that
staff only go hands on with the youth when they are being a danger to themselves
or others. Youth reported whenever they have a concern on the unit, they have
supportive staff to go to.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on July 8, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
07/28/2025
